Reviews.Title: “Different hotel - Unique”
Reviews.Author: drmoore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to the airport and offered free shuttle service. It's an unique hotel. They make the most of small spaces. It was a good experience and would recommend to others. Beds were comfortable loved that there was a complete separate shower / vanity area. Shower was great. Loved the room layout. Our teenage granddaughter thought it was really cool.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not concerned about guests needs”
Reviews.Author: heading_out12
Reviews.Content: No place to refrigerate medicine and the front desk really didn't care. No ice machines so could only get a little ice from the front desk to try and keep medicine cold overnight. No way to freeze ice packs to help for the next day either. Different hotel experience - no little bottles of shampoo or little soaps. There were larger bottles in the shower that stayed from guest to guest. So you have no idea what's really in there.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, noise and more noise”
Reviews.Author: mrswh
Reviews.Content: We (me, my husband and two kids) stayed at the Aloft PHX for one night due to a canceled flight. We had an early morning flight and wanted to be close by the airport but not in a dumpy motel. It was quick and easy to make a reservation; not so much to check in. We had requested connecting rooms and they had us on different floors - it took a while to correct. Oh well, it happens. Shuttle service was prompt, which was appreciated for our 5:00 a.m. departure. (You do have to call the hotel to have them pick you up at the airport - our misinformed reservations person told us they come every 15 minutes and just to wait - we'd have been waiting all day!) The hotel is clean (not the very cleanest but pretty good), and we like the modern concept. The kids had fun playing pool while I checked us in. It's about on par with a newer Courtyard Marriott, but with a more modern/urban look. It's not for everyone, but I like it a whole lot more than cheesy floral bedspreads and dusty drapes. My kids loved the funky elevators and wanted to have a dance party every time we stepped in. The staff was friendly. Free wi-fi and two bottles of free water in the room are nice touches. The pool is small but looked clean - we didn't have time to use it. No real food at the hotel or anywhere close - I called front desk to ask if the shuttle could take us somewhere to eat and was told it would take us anywhere within three miles. When I asked what there is to eat within three miles, I was told, "nothing, really - you have to go a little more than three miles." So we ate at Ruby Tuesday's, which is just on the other side of the parking lot. Would have liked more (better) options but it was fine for one meal. Beds are comfortable (a bit on the firm side but I like that) and the pillows are great. Actually better than at most (more expensive) hotels. I didn't mind the shampoo/soap pumps in the shower but the 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner took the "simple" concept too far for me. (They do have a full size hairdryer though.) A channel lineup for the TV would have been nice. So overall, a fine place to stay - not a ton of amenities but great for an overnight before an early flight. The reason I will not likely stay here again - the noise! For a little perspective, we live in the city and I am really not overly sensitive to noise. We were on the back side of the building, overlooking the pool, but we could still hear plenty of jet noise. On top of the jet noise, the A/C unit (separate unit in each room) was ridiculous. My son (who sleeps like a rock) even woke up to complain about it. And worst of all, the motorcycle noise! Wow. Crazy loud motorcycles, tons of them, revving their engines what seemed like directly below our window, until the wee hours of the morning. I have no idea what that was about - was it some special motorcycle event? Just a Saturday night in the industrial park? I don't know, I just know I got very little sleep prior to my 4:40 alarm. Sooo . . . overall fine if you like the modern/simple concept - but make sure you bring some ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Training Trip”
Reviews.Author: Doyle61
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the hotel and the service. I'm a fan of the Aloft concept - simple & stylish.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - Mediocre amenities”
Reviews.Author: travelingbird333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in the Phoenix area. I was excited to stay at an Aloft hotel, having heard they were upscale. Needless to say this property was a bit of a disappointment. I will start off saying the hotel staff was excellent and friendly. They were very pleasant and helpful at the front desk. The lobby/bar area was very nice, as was a seating area outdoors with a fireplace and space heaters for the chilly nights. A few things to be aware of: The pool is small and only gets sunshine for a few hours a day, being shaded by the building. The towels in our room were like sandpaper! Literally stiff and rough. Breakfast is by purchase only from a convenience area in the lobby. The breakfast sandwiches were not bad. There is no free continental breakfast or coffee. There are no microwaves in the rooms. There are refrigerators, and the coffee maker in our room was nice (a single cup at a time). The maid for our room came about 4:30-5:00 pm. Just about the time we were getting ready for our evening plans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for airport and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: vegasbride07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our last night in Phoenix, and since we wouldn't have a car, we wanted something convenient to both Downtown (we had tickets to see the Phoenix Suns) and to the airport (we had a 6:30am flight). The metro lite rail is literally on the next block, and just a 15 minute ride to Downtown (plus, if you have tickets to an event at the US Airways arena, the train is free). Also, the hotel provides a free airport shuttle. I will say though, that if you are facing Washington Street, you WILL hear the train. I wish we had asked for a room facing the back of the hotel. Also, the bathroom sink area is where the only bathroom light is, so if you shut the lite, the room with the toilet in it is pitch black. Maybe bring a nite lite with you. We try to bring one when we travel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_Utah
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Aloft and we loved it! The accomodations were great. Complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. The pool was clean and always had fresh towels. Workout room was great. The rooms were a little on the small side but it worked. Room was very clean. The air conditioner was quite loud. No microwave in the room but they have one in the lobby that you can use. The staff was amazing and very accomodating. The only drawback was that there were no restaurants within walking distance. The metro rail is right outside their door though and restaurants were only a short train ride away. You can either go to Mill Ave or go the other direction to any of the stops in downtown Phoenix for more options. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience...”
Reviews.Author: iq1012
Reviews.Content: Looks good from outside and is very close to PHX airport and to my workplace. That is a big benefit. Little modern loft concept, rooms are non-traditional with more urban look and sometimes takes little bit of innovative mind to find the iron board :) Staff is good and service is OK. My first stay here in January was excellent , although I did not like the beds as compared to Hilton and Marriott but it was ok. Second stay was not so much of a good experience. Cable TV was not working for almost 95 % of channels, even if I spoke to front desk no resolution was achieved..If you are from a preferred company then breakfast coupon is there to help you else you need to by! Overall it is a mixed experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: A_Thru_Z_Travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed during business for 4 days. They are tryin to form a hip/modern image but I don't think they get traffic from the young crowd. The elevators are lit by black lights all day every day which was a little strange. Restaurants are not located near the hotel which is a downside. Overall a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SteveInSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My new favorite hotel chain. I love the staff at both Aloft hotels I have stayed at. Much more relaxed atmosphere than normal full service hotels. Keep in mind this a very friendly, low service hotel (not valet, not bellman, no one to tip!) They don't have a restaurant but have 24 hour food in the snake area, great sandwiches and salads. In the morning you can purchase hot ham/bacon/sausage/egg croissants I love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “its ok. no prizes.”
Reviews.Author: GMatthehotel
Reviews.Content: just a one nite stay, its ok, room product is hip and modern, but sort of annoyingly so. there is nothing to eat in this area, except a Ruby Tuesday across the street which was filthy. staff at desk are fine, hi, checking in, heres your key. The little fridge at the desk has sandwiches in it, which work in a pinch. bottom line, you will survive a night.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in Phoenix for a night due to a missed connection”
Reviews.Author: laweber28
Reviews.Content: Fit the bill - close to the airport, and part of Starwood. Room was nice - definitely geared towards the young male crowd (think car magazines in the room). Staff was very nice and very helpful. Shuttle to the airport was right on time.

Reviews.Title: “New experience turned out great”
Reviews.Author: Ron85541
Reviews.Content: As long time Platinum members of Starwood we stay at many different properties. Our first stay at an Aloft property was a very pleasant surprise. Nice lobby, comfortable rooms and a great location. Close to Sky Harbor airport, restaurants, Phoenix Zoo and the main highways running thru the Phoenix area. We were really empressed with Julia, the gal that helped us with check-in and information about the hotel. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, good value”
Reviews.Author: EatingRaoul
Reviews.Content: This was a great value and a fun place to stay. The front desk staff on arrival was very friendly and honored our request for a room on the quiet side of the hotel. We drove in for the Insight Bowl and being at a light rail stop, we were able to leave the car parked all weekend. The rooms are not really designed for an extended stay as they are smallish without a lot of storage space. The bathroom is trendy with the glass enclosed shower, no tub. The large shower head could have been positioned further from the wall. Minor stuff. The bartender, I think his name is Joshua, was fabulous and helpful, he has a great disposition and enjoyed helping people. Overall, staying at aLOFT in Phoenix was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: mtnwanderers
Reviews.Content: I enjoy Aloft properties as an affordable, fun and free Internet option. This one is not the nicest I've visited, but close to airport with free shuttle. It offers a nice happy hour and some limited but acceptable food options. There is a small pool, although I did not use. The rooms are small and a bit worn given the age of this hotel, but have everything needed including a fridge. The staff is friendly and helpful. This is a good one night airport option, but not in a good location for longer stays to Phx.

Reviews.Title: “Modern features & Convenient to Sky Harbor”
Reviews.Author: davidpokey
Reviews.Content: If you haven't yet stayed at the aLOFT properties, this one near the airport is quite convenient because the hotel offers shuttle service to Sky Harbor airport & is adjacent to the new light rail line, to travel downtown. aLOFT features great room amenities, including large shower stall, modern amenities & refrigerator. Food is available in the Lobby, although you must pay for it. The bar is trendy is could be a nice place to unwind. The outdoor pool was great, even in 115 degree heat!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and a little worn out”
Reviews.Author: Nardiesally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aloft right near the airport. The shuttle was great. My room was a little worn out. I liked the style and the room was highly functionable. The workout facilities were fine too, albeit a little limited. My major complaint was the noise level of my room. I had a room facing the road which was noisy for most of the night. I was on the 4th floor. I would ask for a room that faced the other side of the hotel which I imagine is much less noisy.

Reviews.Title: “does the job”
Reviews.Author: jos_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed because we were in Phoenix one night and wanted to be close to the airport, they have a free shuttle to and from the airport. It was walking distance to the skytrain/metro. The lobby has a small bar and a lounge-y area with a pool table which is great before and after a night out. The ambience was just really relaxed. When we checked in the receptionist handed us a copy of Spin and Wired magazine, and I noticed she was doing this with everyone, which just added to the hip ambience. Our room had Bliss toiletries which was great! Our room was fresh and clean. The arrangement made full use of the small quarters, which if we were staying for longer than the one night we stayed, may have been frustrating, but for one night and light packers it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Simply 'wowed'!”
Reviews.Author: lovetohittheroad
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the hip decor and construction of the lobby area and the bar. It wasn't very large but everything was situated perfectly, with a pool table in the bar area. There was a Grab n' Go section in the lobby for quick eats for sandwiches, salads, snacks and hot breakfast in the morning. The rooms are small but the configurations were so perfect that we never felt cramped. No bathtubs but large showers w/bath gel and shampoo/conditioner dispensers. There was a universal audio/video connection box on the work desk, So that you could connect your iPod, iPad, computer or whatever to view on the flat screen TV. We requested a late check-out and the answer "Sure, how about 2pm". The decor was very mod/hip. Blackout shades too.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: crazyteapot
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at this Aloft. They have a shuttle that runs to the airport and does require a reservation (just to make sure they have enough space). So close, it is very quick to get to the airport. They have coffee on hand and offer a variety of items for purchase. They do have a small bar in lobby area and a pool table. Computers are available to print boarding passes. Coffee maker in your room with a small fridge and a great flat screen tv. Love the hip urban vibe. Phoenix local metro/railstop right in front of hotel. They also have very comfy beds. I am not sure they have room service as they have a 24 hr. self service area in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place with a bit of a hip factor”
Reviews.Author: Bingo_the_dog
Reviews.Content: Aloft Phoenix The Aloft hotels are a great concept - standard, efficient accommodation in handy locations at a good price.  They're for the people on the move: from an Aloft you can easily get to where you need to be.  But unlike several other hotels of this kind, they are not those anonymous and depressing places. On the contrary, Aloft hotels are young, vibrant, with a catchy design and all the services you need. Including a cool bar (xyz), a good fitness room, and a nice lounge/lobby which is actually pleasant and warm.  The smart thing about Aloft is that all hotels are basically identical. Once you've been to one, you know how they work and you easily find what you need, without surprises. The Aloft Phoenix is very close to the airport; a free shuttle will take you to/from the airport or any other place within a couple of miles. It's also next to the train stop to downtown Phoenix, and a few buses stop there too. So if you don't have a car you won't be disappointed.  The staff is very friendly and efficient; the rooms are like all other Alofts: smart, cool and just perfect to crash after a long day or a long flight. The bed is very comfortable, one of the best for this class of hotels. The pillows though are a bit hard - the must be foam, and as already noted they're not the best you can find. The bathroom is cleverly designed, with the sink in an open area and the shower and toilet area can be closed with a sliding door. It doesn't offer full privacy though, but nevertheless it can be shared with a travel companion if you need to. Bliss products are a nice touch, and in your room you will also find free bottled water, a coffe/tea set and some cool recent magazines (like Wired).  This Aloft has also a nice outdoor patio with swimming pool. Nothing fancy, but just perfect to relax outside and cool down.  The fitness room is small but good - a few treadmills, a multi functional exercise machine and a few other accessories (weights, balls). In the morning there are also hot breakfast item to buy at re:fuel, the "grab and go" food concept of Aloft. Other items are available 24 hours so no matter when and how you get there, you won't starve.    So if you need a place close to the airport where you won't feel depressed the Aloft is a perfect choice. Add the friendliness of the staff and the hip factor which Aloft has inherited from the W hotels and you're all set!

Reviews.Title: “different but not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: explore2b
Reviews.Content: cute funky boutique hotel but rooms are small. There's no ice machine, you have to go down to cafe (which feels more like serve yourself cafeteria) to get a bag. Not easy to find entrance to hotel and parking lot. But decor and colors are unique and staff was friendly. I think if I was in my 20's it would be cool and fun but as i'm getting older I tend to prefer more luxury feel to a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Pillows”
Reviews.Author: sapo60
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with great rooms and good customer service, having said that, the pillows in the room are the hardest and most uncomfortable I have ever slept on, and I spend over 100 nights a year in hotels. It appears others have also complained as when I told the front desk personnel, they said others have issued the same criticism and they will be changing their pillows in January. I would recommend avoiding this hotel in January 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel I've been in; regardless of faux-boutique decor”
Reviews.Author: FMDtraveler
Reviews.Content: I don't see this faux-boutique decor as an issue. I think it works great when compared to other mid-grade or economy options. This place is extremely clean, well appointed, unique, very accessible from the airport - they have a free shuttle, the bed was extremely comfortable and the way its set up really maximizes the square footage. They have a made to order breakfast bar with fresh, healthy options. A pool table in the lobby, ample lounge seating . . . My only complaints - the bar closed at 11 PM (I assume because it was dead on a Wednesday night) and it's a little noisy by the airport ,but that's to be expected. I would not only stay at an Aloft Starwood hotel again, but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it - trying too hard to be a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: michellew100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aloft on the last night of our one week trip to Arizona. We chose this property due to it's proximity to the Phoenix airport. There is nothing wrong with this hotel - it was clean and had the employees were friendly - we were just not very impressed. Part of the problem, for us, might be that we live in DC where there are great, boutiquey hotels. This Aloft just felt like it was trying way too hard for that boutique feel and falling flat. It seemed to me like a very average hotel whose mgmt did not want to put in the money to make it nicer so they made it "different" with 70's style decorating and an attempt at a retro feel. We went to the bar, for a drink before heading out to dinner, during happy hour. I asked the bartender what the happy hour wines were (they were not listed anywhere); she did not bother to tell me that the ones I chose was not a special. I noticed it when I signed the check. We paid $159 for our stay - for that amount I would suggest a hampton or that type of place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!! Close to Light Rail and ASU!”
Reviews.Author: yogatraveler30
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot near the airport, Light Rail, and ASU. Hotel was perfect in every way and the staff went above and beyond to make my stay memorable. I travel on business and also like to practice yoga when I travel and Joy at the front desk made sure I had yoga information when I checked in. This will be my hotel of choice when traveling to the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel w/ Easy Transportation Access”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came into town for a wedding and we were attending an ASU game as well. The proximity to the light rail was GREAT! We could hop on and take it to downtown Phoenix or to downtown Tempe. The hotel itself had a great lobby, great pool and great retro/urban rooms which was a nice change of pace to the traditional hotel room. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Different and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: pjwilliams69
Reviews.Content: When we walked into this hotel it was like none other we have seen. With its hip decor and friendly staff we felt like we entered a nightclub. This was more than just a place to lay your head. The beds are very comfortable and there are little surprises at every turn. Free Wi-Fi and shuttle service is nice. You are right outside of the Light Tram (kind of like a trolley system) and within walking distance to a Ruby Tuesday. I suggest taking the Tram into Tempe and shopping and dining. I only wish there were more Alofts out there. When you are in the elevator make sure to look at the floor and move your feet around. Where you step turns whiteish and the black style lighting is cool. There is a pool but we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: inthemiddle63
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently took a trip to Sedona, Arizona. Our flight leaving Phoenix was at 6am, so I thought it best to stay close to the airport. I booked a room online at Aloft Phoenix Hotel based only on the photographs I had viewed on their site. Wow! What a fabulous, clean hotel with many "cool", "Hip" and welcoming amenities. The room was very modern, with the best shower I have ever experienced, and the bed, lighting and walk down the corridor to our room was so inviting, warm and posh! They had free High Speed Internet and a very large flatscreen TV if you have kids! My son broke a set of headphones, and called down to the desk to see if he could buy a pair, and the concierge told him there were some available in the fitness room. He worked out in the more than adequate clean gym, took a swim in the very modern pool and then was allowed to bring the headphones up to listen to music and keep! Anything we asked for, they had. Shuttle service was quick and free, gourmet coffee in the room, great smelling soaps, and very comfortable surroundings. They have a bar, lounge area, pool table, breakfast area with food to buy. There is a very good Ruby Tuesday's around the corner with great burgers, great tilapia and great service!! The real surprise came when I awoke the next morning to find the bill under my door. $79 for our entire stay! Where on earth can you score a price like that for such a great, brand new hotel! I cannot say enough about this new, hip place. If you want everything at your fingertips and a good night's sleep before your flight, book a room at Aloft now!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Unique!”
Reviews.Author: Avondaletraveler
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot each year, mostly for pleasure. For this trip we just needed a place to rest our car for the week (saving the $80 to park it at the airport) and for us for one night, then a 5am shuttle ride to/from the airport, which went off without a hitch. Firstly, the rooms are small but very well designed, every bit of space is accounted for and it's quite modern. Love the connecting door painted like a gym locker! Glad to have the free bottles of water, always appreciated in the desert! We loved the lounge with the board games while we waiting for some drinks, as well as the self serve cafe. The pool and gym ares were small but well appointed and we used both. Now the bad. For whatever reason, there is not a seperate light in the bathroom area. If you need to use the facilities after bedtime your choice is to bump into things in the dark, or wake the whole room by illuminating it. Oddity number two, we only had tiny almost travel sized pillows on our beds. I ended up rolling off it a couple of times. My 7 year old daughter's little kids pillow from home was bigger. Lastly, good luck if you're staying here for more than a couple of days, since there is NO REAL CLOSET or DRAWERS. In the bathroom there is a little curtain with some decending hooks to hang a few things. Overall, a cute property that's well priced and different than other offerings in this price range. We'd definitely stay here again if just for the overnight (although I'd bring a nightlight and request a bigger pillow next time.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice locaeion”
Reviews.Author: lkcare
Reviews.Content: Location is close to airport and freeways making it easy to get around. No airport noise or train noise from my room. Staff suggested rooms opposite of commuter train. First stay in Alofy room met needs. Ruby Tuesday restaurant next door for lunch aand dinner. Staff was freindly, pool was nice as is bar with pool table. What you should get for business travelor.

Reviews.Title: “nice but probably not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: this airport is VERY clean, modern, new, well-equipped. free parking. free wifi was fast & reliable. fitness center was modern & nice & clean. room was very clean and modern, but a little small by phoenix standards (where space is easy to come by and real estate is cheap). the entrance to the hotel parking lot is weird. a little confusing and you have to go the long way around every time to get in. the bed wasnt bad by any means, but not the most comfortable. a little hard with a pad under the sheet that shifted around. the walls are thin -- you can hear all other goings-on on the floor for a great price, i'd stay here again without hesitation, but there are other places i like better.

Reviews.Title: “very weird hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovefood99
Reviews.Content: This is a modern-looking hotel, which could be appreciated by some people, but I didn't like this hotel and I will never come back here again. My room was at the top floor because of my SPG goldmembership status. The view from my room was kind of nice, but I didn't like my room because of 1) no bath tub, 2) no towel hunger by the sink, 3) very small desk to work, 4) square pillows, 5) AC adjuster located in a very inconvenient place in the room, and 6) very low water pressure in the shower. Before this hotel, I stayed at Sheraton for 4 nights in Ann Arbor and my experience with the hotel was much better. I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Expereince in years”
Reviews.Author: testmachine
Reviews.Content: 30 minute to get shuttle from airport...driver said had only 5 pickups all day so wasn't busy. Checking was slowed by 1 staff person answering phones and trying to check me in. Ice had to be retrieved from the lobby. Went to bar to eat to be told they were out of half of the food on the menu and at breakfast was told out of American cheese. Not that I am particular, but would seem like a staple food. Finally, no wakeup call as scheduled. There was an appearance that they could not pay their food contractor bill and had skeleton staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the 5 a.m. random wakeup call...with no apology from staff!”
Reviews.Author: Devo18
Reviews.Content: We were seduced by the hip factor of the Aloft brand of Starwood hotels and appreciated the proximity to the Phoenix Airport. The check-in person encouraged us profusely to take advantage of the Happy Hour at the hotel bar: $4 beer, $5 wine. How could we resist? When we ordered just that and then got a bill for $12 (not $9), the bartender told us it was for house wines and beers only. The hotel is plastered with signs for this Happy Hour, but no fine print about prices. And no apology from bartender. To top it off, we wanted to take advantage of our late flight home the next day by sitting at the pool in the morning and reading the papers. However, we got a random automatic wakeup call at 5 a.m. (which we obviously didn't order) and could not get back to sleep. Absolutely no apology from staff except for a shoulder shrug. Get hip, Aloft, with your customer service if you want this hotel to survive!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bob90024
Reviews.Content: Most importantly, you need to understand what Aloft hotels are. They are a unique select service hotel chain which offer a more modern design and unique amenities. They are great for some people, and not so great for others. Please do your research and decide if they are for you or not. For me the concept seemed great, and I was very happy with my stay. The location is great for PHX airport. The room design is good for me, it has a big bed, flatscreen TV, very smart bathroom and closet layout with stand up shower (no rub) and a non-closet closet (not good for long stays). They offer a free bottle of water in the room and free coffee in the room. The room was very neat and clean and comfortable. It has a window unit AC but it's a new version so not any louder than a regular hotel AC. The hotel does not have free breakfast but it has a good variety of paid breakfast options, two computers with free internet access, a nice bar area and a gym and pool. The staff isn't anything extraordinary but they aren't bad either. Parking is ample and free and the hotel feels safe (exterior well lit and outside doors locked). If you are accustomed to and like the traditional hotel room style, you may or may not like Aloft. I personally don't like tub showers with dirty curtain, small rooms, crummy TVs on TV stands and ugly carpet, so for me this hotel was a great change. I will stay at an Alfot again if the opportunity presents itself. I am an SPG Gold member and I do seek out SPG properties.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location near Skyharbor”
Reviews.Author: randall_one
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK. We have stayed at another ALoft and did not care for the design or amenities. We needed to stay at a place near the airport for an early flight and used the SPG cash and points option to get this hotel for one night for $45. The fron desk staff were quick and efficient including giving great directions to get into their parking lot. (If you ever stay there, you'll know what I mean). They also offered great suggestions for dinner about a ten minute drive away on Mill St. The hotel was an exact copy of the one we had stayed at previously. The main lobby layout and rooms were identical. The rooms are the real issue here. They are small with not great seating areas. The fit and finish are not up to Starwood standards and the lack of closets and drawers is a bit odd. It was fine for us as we were there for one night, but any longer stay would probably be annoying. I think the design of the overall hotel was meant to be industrial-modern and they have in fact accomplished this. But you have to like that style. As it was a Starwood property, it was clean and well maintained as expected. Again, fine for an overniter at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Close quarters”
Reviews.Author: thequen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not in the best neighborhood! Nothing is close by except a circle k which didn't look safe to walk into. Hotel is in a business park. Not a place for kids, the walls are very thin. I have a 3 yrs old and his fighting his sleep at 8pm got security called on him. Listen to those thin walls after a couple had a little to drink at the bar down stairs. Again not a place for kids

Reviews.Title: “What a cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnadler
Reviews.Content: Great modern design, it's not four seasons. For the price it's one of the best kept secrets. Rooms are small but extremely functional with great tv's

Reviews.Title: “great option near airport”
Reviews.Author: thedeanguy
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at Aloft but had heard alot about it. We had an early morning flight from Phoenix and this was a great option as it's mere few minutes from the airport. It's a great concept, fun and funky ambiance, low key and friendly. Seem to cater to the 20 something traveler. The rooms are large and just enough in them...not overloaded with bulky furniture. My only complaint was you could clearly hear your neighboring hotel guests while in your room. I almost participated in a conversation at one point! not sure if this is typical of all Aloft or only this one. It wouldn't keep me from staying at another Aloft but it will definitely keep me from staying at this one again. I will say I would recommend it though on the reivew as if the price is right...and your flight is earlier.... just bring your earplugs

Reviews.Title: “Great at double the price!”
Reviews.Author: bagoda1
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for one night, and wanted something close to the airport. After noting the hotel's affiliation the The W chain of hotels, and seeing a $65.00 a night rate, I figured that I had little to lose. Boy am I glad that I did! The hotel is super cool, spotlessly clean, fun, trendy, new, exciting, functional - I could go on and on. The room was small, but arranged so well that it did not seem small. The bed is great, the shower had a large rain shower head, and the room offered coffee, tea and bottled water for free. There is "communal" shampoo, etc. in the shower (pump dispensers) which I am not crazy about, but that only bothered me a tiny bit. I received a complementary sedan ride to the airport the next morning, and the young guy at reception and the nice guy making sandwiches in the "snack bar" area could not have been nicer. I usually stay at the Four Seasons in Phoenix. Unless I have to be in that area, I never will again when I can get such great treatment and cool surroundings for $65.00. I will also hunt down Alofts in other cities when I travel!

Reviews.Title: “Aloft continues to impress”
Reviews.Author: tigerhunt2011
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Aloft Phoenix Airport, and I was extremely pleased once again with this trendy, modern hotel. The beds are slightly firm, but the room is delightful. Whoever designed them needs an award! Power outlets and light switches NEXT TO THE BED?? WHOA! Also, the desk connecton-point and charging station for iPhones, iPods etc was very helpful this trip. It was inconvenient that I couldn't print US Airways Boarding Passes from the Touchscreen Kiosk, but I was able to print them easily from the full desktop computers in the lobby. The fitness center is top-notch, I love that I could control my iPhone's musuc from the touchscreen. And Starwood has knocked it out of the park withj free airport transfers from Aloft. We stayed at Aloft the night before a morning flight to New York, and we left our car at Aloft the whole time. After we landed back in Phoenix, I called Aloft to see if we could arrange for transportatoin back to the hotel to get our car, and they sent a black towncar to Sky Harbor for free to get us back. Outstandnig service, bravo Aloft!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Fun and Functional...a Perfect 2-Night Vacation Stop!”
Reviews.Author: TheRoamingGnomette
Reviews.Content: If quiet, ease, and convenience are top priorities, this hotel will not disappoint! We used the free hotel shuttle, which arrived within minutes of our call. It was a very quick ride to the hotel, which is clean, bright and modern. Check-in was a breeze, although there was only one staff member at the counter. She was pleasant and knowledgeable. The room itself was simple and well-planned. High shelves in the bathroom area enabled us to keep some things out of toddler reach. Instead of table lamps, space-saving built-in sconces smartly lit the room. The shower (no tub) was stocked with high-quality shower gel and shampoo in convenient wall-mounted dispensers- no fumbling with those tiny bottles! Our room was very quiet- we did not hear any others in the hotel, nor did we hear any airplanes. The cube mini-fridge was just enough for keeping drinks and leftovers. The lobby is bright, spacious and airy. The pool table and board games kept our small son engaged; the internet kiosks were a bit slow, but fine for a short e-mail checking session. Although there are two boarding-pass-printing stations, the screens are placed at chest-level; I found those hard to use, so I printed our boarding passes from the internet kiosks instead. The Ruby Tuesday restaurant, just behind the hotel parking lot, was, according to my husband, "surprisingly good!" and I agreed. The Circle K convenience store, next to the hotel, came in handy since we did not rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: tskelton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights while in Phoenix on business. I had 3 large boxes shipped there piror to my check in. They brought them to my room with out hassel. The front desk was very nice and helpful. Room was big and had a great layout, love the modern feel. It was also quite the AC worked like a charm. Aloft is a great brand for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelllady
Reviews.Content: I like that the Aloft hotels are not your typical hotel. They are a little trendy and quirky. They are also all that you expect from a hotel, clean, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Option”
Reviews.Author: ccraven001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Phoenix Aloft in June 2010 prior to an early flight. The hotel was very clean. The hotel is a quick walk to a Ruby Tuesday. The Alofts are a budget brand of W Hotels. The rooms are hip with Bliss bath products. The fitness center is very nice. Built-in tvs on the treadmill and other nice equipment. The employees at this hotel provided great service. My only complaint is with the air conditioner. It was very noisy when it cycled on and off and woke me up throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “A nice change!!!”
Reviews.Author: stevejr32
Reviews.Content: I experienced a wonderful time at this new upcoming hotel chain. The staff assisted in every way possible. The bar and the bartender was EXCELLENT!!! I was very pleased with the hotel, and everything that they offered. If you are tired of the same hotel rooms and want something different then go to this hotel. Get ready for a change in hotel revolution and enjoy the experience of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and stylish great for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: BigBlueOcean7
Reviews.Content: The people are friendly and the amenities just right for most business travelers. New furniture, wired and wi-fi internet, and a comfy bed. The rooms are a little small but if you're only there to sleep, it shouldn't be an issue. I plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good only for the minimalist.”
Reviews.Author: trvlmnke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, clean, and has a modern flare. I wouldn't fool yourself into thinking it's like the W - it's a cheaped down version of a W wannabe, a step up from the Four Points chain. There are very few amenities, so if you're looking for room service, a bathtub, or movies - just forget it. The hotel seems to also be short-staffed. The only snack bar is near the entrance and the cashier is the same person that checks you in. If you have any needs exceeding a clean bed and shower, then you'll ge highly disappointed. The room does come with a fridge, coffee maker, safe, and a complimentary bottle of water a day, and, the biggest plus for me, they use Bliss products.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Modern Oasis of Calming Energy”
Reviews.Author: JMMasterson
Reviews.Content: My recent review of the "W Perimeter" in Atlanta may hint at my disdain for poor service and impractical useless fashion when the basic expectations of a good hotel are not met. As a frequent business traveler, my expectations for hotel cleanliness, room comfort and amenities, and basic service have become rather particular, and I am quick to compliment or criticize a hotel based on these standards. That's why I'm so pleased to tell you that the Aloft Phoenix-Airport met, and in many cases exceeded, all of my expectations for a good hotel for a business traveler, and was the antithesis of all the things I dislike about the W experience. From the moment I walked into Aloft, I knew I was in for a refreshingly calm, friendly, and full-service experience at a tremendous price. I was greeted with a warm "Aloha" (a strange greeting for a non-Hawaian-themed hotel), and a smile as I walked into a lobby that was beautifully-crafted to make you feel bright, energized, and at home. From the open plan to the modern-and-bright colors to the pool table to the sharp-but-casual bar, the lobby was akin to an upscale European hostel (if such a thing exists)... the kind of place where you feel comfortable and almost COMPELLED to strike up conversations with people from many different walks of life. Every staff member I met was tremendously authentic and genuinely congenial, and went out of their way to make sure we were having a good stay. From the front desk people who showed us how to quickly-and-easily print some documents at the business center (no charge) to the bartender who recommended a restaurant and hand-drew directions for us to the general "talent manager" who greeted us each morning in the lobby to ask how our stay was... I felt like each staff member really enjoyed their jobs, and genuinely WANTED us to have a good time. The room itself was a tremendously well-planned smaller space that will feel right at home for those who enjoy boutique European hotels. The bed was amazingly comfortable, the room clean and very new, and the decor simultaneously ultra-modern and relaxing. Unlike the W (form over function), the room was a testament to the beautiful synergy of form AND function, with intuitive and natural placement of all amenities, from lightswitches to towels to outlets, etc. (Again, compare to the W, where I had to move the bed to find an outlet). Wi-fi was very strong in my 4th-floor room, and it was FREE (again, compare to the W, where it was not available at all in the room, and cost $10+ a day to use the wired cord). The shower was roomy and very clean and comfortable, featuring a clever frosted window into the room to allow natural light in. The sink and toilets were modern-looking but worked perfectly (again, unlike the W). I encourage you to stay at the Aloft Phoenix-Airport next time you're in Phoenix, and leave the W Scottsdale to a fashionista who wants to be seen in the lobby. If you're a Starwood junkie with a deep-seated disdain for the W, I think you'll find the Aloft a very refreshing return to the Starwood values and quality that got you into their hotels to begin with. Here's the kicker...and all for a room that cost almost half of the W.

Reviews.Title: “Good Features make for a nice stay. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: glacial_erratic
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at an aLoft hotel, and it is a very interesting concept. Overall, I liked it and would choose an aLoft in certain circumstances in the future. At first glance, it reminded me of an upscale dorm, but not in a bad way! It is obviously aimed at young travelers, but worked quite well for this 50-something traveler. The decor is modern, slighty industrial, and mostly Ikea-esque. But I liked it! The desk staff was mostly young, wearing polo shirts instead of suits, but they were friendly and helpful. Check in and any questions were handled quickly and and they didn;t make me feel like I was the "old person". There were people of all ages staying there. The lobby has lots of couches and chairs, a bar with several TV's, a computer access area, a pool table and a small area with foods to purchase. The food items included a good variety of choices including salads, sandwiches, breakfast items, soda, juices, snack bars, items to microwave, and other things. Prices were reasonable. At first glance in the room, I was skeptical, but after checking it out a bit, I really liked some of the features! First, there are LOTS of outlets - and none are behind furniture! So there is no problem with all of the tech gear! There is a large desk, a table, a built-in bench/couch that a small person could probably sleep on if needed. The closet is open, with a curtain and open shelves. There is no dresser or drawers. The bathroom has a LARGE countertop, which was great, and a sliding door to close off the toilet/shower area. There is also a cube fridge. All of the furniture is built-in. The rooms seemed to be pretty well sound insulated, it was pretty quiet when I was there, but it wasn't very high occupancy. The wireless internet is free! And there is a unit on the desk to plug your electronics (laptop, games, etc) and you can show it on the large HD TV. Parking is free, but I found that I did not use my rental car, since the Metro was fast, cheap and convenient. There is a nice patio and small pool with lots of chairs and couches. The building shades the pool/patio by mid-afternoon, so if you want sun, go earlier in the day. The location is great, right across the street from the free airport shuttle drop-off spot, across the street from the Metro (light rail) station (All day pass is $3.50, get to the Convention Center in about 20 minutes!), next to a convenience store, and just steps to a Ruby Tuesday Restaurant (not fine dining, but OK when you just need a meal!) Overall I really liked it, but there were a couple of drawbacks -the biggest one was that the heating/cooling unit in room was loud (you had to change the TV volume every time it went on or off) and it created a draft. Other minor issues were that occasionally airplane noise was a bit loud, but not a huge problem, and in the bathroom there are no rods or hooks to hang your hand towel near the sink. So for a comfiortable, convenient room near the Phoenix airport, the aLoft hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A ray of sunshine with exceptional service in the desert !”
Reviews.Author: Geekontherun
Reviews.Content: If your traveling on business this is the place to stay! They offer shuttle service to and from the airport. They are SOOOO nice and truly care about their guests. They PAMPER you! I am a seasoned traveler and they treated me like the goddess I know I am! I left my bags at the desk when I arrived and when I came back after work they had my bags set up for me. They had my fridge with diet sodas, cookies, tooth brush, tooth paste, and razor waiting for me! They were cheerful when I arrived (VERY EARLY) put me in a cozy room with a great view of the mountains. It is close to the airport, Tempe, Phoenix, and rental car facility. Across the street from the light rail which can take you to anywhere including some of the well know restaurants such as Raw, Macayos, Gordon Biersch just to name a few. There are shops and boutiques along mill avenue. Arizona Mills is an outlet mall (need a car rental or taxi) nearby. They also have Tempe Marketplace (also taxi or rental car) which has clothing stores, restaurants, and movie theatre. Camelback mountain which is popular for hiking is about 15 minutes away! You can eat downstairs for breakfast or pickup food to go. They have a bar that is open at 5 pm with snacks and food service if you are exhausted and don't want to leave. They have several places you can have snacks at within the hotel if you don't want to leave. They have a workout facility that is amazing! So if you want to be treated like a queen pick this one :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location near airport, rooms small”
Reviews.Author: skyeport
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during spring training in Phoenix. The location near the airport and the price were just fine. The bar was a good place to hang out and the staff friendly. The rooms were on the small side but mostly comfortable. The main thing I didn't like was the organization of the room. The bathroom is open to the room and when you walk in the first thing you see. There is a sliding door that doesn't close all the way on the shower and toilet stall. It was kind of odd. The hotel has a very youthful and trendy vibe to it. There are not a lot of restaurants nearby except a Ruby Tuesday, though if you drive a couple a miles there is a Starbucks and maybe some other options. The hotel was located close to major highways to get to spring training games around the city. Also the high speed internet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sn0wRunner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aloft for two days in late March. We really liked the change from the typical room design and found there to be plenty of space. If you're a traveler that needs to uppack your suitcase there is not a lot of room to put your clothing. Even though we were close to the airport and on a major street, noise was not a concern. On occassion we could hear some planes taking off. We did not have any concerns with noise from within the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool area was small and crowded, and in the shade much of the afternoon. Other than being close to the airport, there is not a lot to do close by the hotel unless you have a car. Within a 10 minute drive there are shopping and eating options. The hotel has good freeway access.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, comfortable business travel hotel”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: This place is brand new and spotless. The gym is of a good size and very nicely equipped. The service is excellent. There is not a restaraunt onsite but there is a Ruby Tuesday in the parking lot. There is a nice bar in the lobby as well. The comments regarding thin walls are unfortunately true. This is true of most commuter hotels though. Most of the hotels around the airport are fairly noisy. The neighborhood is a bit rough but convenient. Overall this is an excellent, clean, comfortable hotel. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, trendy, but not a great room.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay ever at an Aloft. We liked the trendy setting of the lobby. It is modern and colorful. There is plenty of space to hang around, chat, surf internet and/or have a beer. The staff was very cooperative, welcoming and helpful with suggestions. Rooms have a college dorm feel. They are small. The working desk is very small and cramped. The bed was confortable, but the duvet/blanket was way too hot for the room. The room has a HD TV but the viewing angle is very limited (basically from bed only). There is only a shower albeit a large one. The clientele the night we stayed seemed to be composed only of a bunch of teenagers. At some point they invaded the lobby, but were respectful. Our room had a nice view of the airport. Bottom line: a convenient airport hotel with a trendy look, but not so great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: globalbiztravler
Reviews.Content: First stay at an Aloft and was not impressed at all. Rooms have a college dorm feel. The desk was very small. TV was not viewable from the desk, so forget working out of your room while watching CNBC. Food was terrible... tomato and mozzarella salad was below the quality of what you would get at an airport "grab and go" station. For an brand new hotel near the airport, I found it noisy. You can hear every car on the street and every plane taking off. I love the W hotels, but can't understand why Starwood would tarnish the W brand by associating it with the Aloft chain. I will never stay at an Aloft again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient for early airport flights, better than average for hotels in this space”
Reviews.Author: Agent9
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Aloft Phoenix as I needed a place close to the airport. For what I was looking for and for a reasonable price, It was very clean, wdesigned to have a W style vibe on smaller scale (in fact, even the bath products were Bliss but smaller containers and the shampoo and body wash in the shower were the industrial, refillable type which I thought went a little too far in trying to cut costs). The room was small, and had built in wall ac which was a bit noisy but the bed was very comfortable so I slept well despite the airport noise. For what I was looking for, clean, convenient to airport, reasonable price, it fit the bill on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “Aloft Hotel - European quality at an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miteddy7
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Portland on business and needed a room at the airport because my flight was so early in the morning. Rather than stay at the Sheraton, it was recommended that I stay at the Aloft which is a Starwood property. The hotel is new, very clean and has super trendy puplic spaces. I was helped by a nice employee named Paul. The bed was super comfortable. The only thing I didnt like was the sink - it was a wash basin bowl and water spattered out of it. Everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: CalP0ly
Reviews.Content: Brand new Property by the Starwood Group, This seems to be Starwood's answer to Hyatt's "Hyatt Place" chain,and Starwood trumps! This is a basically a EURO MOD, limited Service budget version of the high end "The W"chain, however Starwood Gold and Platinum guest should expect no upgrade, only 2 types of rooms are offered. The hotel is extremely Euro Mod in design and furnishings (See pics), in fact my room is very similar to a room i had in Spain at the Le Meridian, Barcelona (STarwood). Adequate desk and workspace with convenient power ports, a interface to play video and audio on the Phillips Flat screen TV in the room, large roomy king bed with nice headboard and good lighting and a great Retro Alarm Clock (In form and function)! Bathroom and shower are small, the water pressure in the shower is abysmal, too bad as they have a fun and funky large round shower head that would be a treat with decent water pressure. Bliss Spa products in the bathroom ( Ala The W chain) is a real surprise!. Not a big fan of the shampoo and body wash dispensers in the shower, but they appear tamper resistant. Sadly, they skimped a bit on the bedding, the sheets and pillow cases are coarse and of a low thread count. many limited service hotels have upgrading their bedding these days so it is a bit surprising to see a Starwood new chain, the company being known to have started the upgraded bedding wars with their "Heavenly Bed", skimp in this department. But I love this hotel, maybe it is the ultra modern rooms at a great price point, or the excellent accommodating genuinely friendly staff, The Free Wifi all over the hotel, the cool bar downstairs and funky lobby, it all works. The Aloft does not have room service, they do offer a limited food selection at a food and beverage pantry next to the front desk, however next door is a convenience store and behind the hotel is a Ruby Tuesday restaurant. The hotel is located at a Rail stop, 10 minuets straight to downtown and the convention center for $1.50. Airport Shuttle runs on the half hour in the mornings and on demand other hours, 5 Minuets from PHX. I was very pleased with Aloft, having stayed at various PHX airport properties, this is my new favorite!

HotelInfo.Name: Aloft Phoenix-Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 4450 East Washington, Phoenix, AZ 85034
